answers.answer: My daughter measured 80-90% at 19 weeks and was born at 39 weeks weighing 8 lbs 7.1 oz
Dani, I sincerely hope that's the case with me and my daughter.  Thanks for sharing!

At 35 weeks my baby was measuring in the 96 percentile. At 24 weeks she was about 1.7 pounds. Found out at 35 weeks I have gestational diabetes even though I passed the 3 hour glucose test. I would say watch your carb and sugar intake just in case.

I was freaked out at 34 weeks, they said her head was developing normal but her body was at the 50% I was honestly freaked. Thankfully in only 10 days she had gained and developed almost 2lbs making everything more"equaled out" lol. Due any day and she's estimated at 7lbs. I also was a preemie so her size shocked me, also was 114lbs when I got pregnant and I still look super tiny so ita hard to believe she's so big

My son measured in the 83rd percentile also from 22weeks until he was born. I was induced at 36 weeks due to ovarian cyst and he was an 8lb preemie. I was like PREEMIE?! lol but yes doc said he wasnt technically full term until 37 weeks gestation. I couldnt imagine how big he wouldve been at full term! Good luck! :)
My son measured in the 95% and was born 6 days late weighing 8.13, don't worry about it, they don't measure very accurately with ultrasounds

question: She's measuring in the 83rd percentile!  I'm a FTM and 24 weeks, and she's already 1 lb, 11 ounces.  I was a preemie, and so was EVERYONE in my family, so my daughter is already almost 1/2 of what I weighed at birth!  Has anyone else had a baby measuring big but come out "normal"/average size?  I'm starting to freak about the thought of having a 12 lb baby.
title: baby measuring big.
